message.content:
Some fun facts about railway stations include:

1. The world's highest railway station is Tanggula Railway Station in Tibet, standing at 5,068 meters (16,627 feet) above sea level.

2. Clapham Junction, located in London, UK, is the busiest railway station in Europe by train movements per day – over 2,000 trains pass through it each day.

3. Grand Central Terminal in New York City has been featured in numerous famous movies and television shows such as "Gossip Girl," "The Avengers," and "Men In Black."

4. The Flinders Street Railway Station, opened on September 12th of 1854; Located in Melbourne, Australia was the first city or suburban station that was constructed on this continent.

5. Nairobi Railway Station enables travelers to ride alongside Kenya's wildlife while taking them from Mombasa to Nairobi.

6. Shinjuku Station which is situated in Tokyo-Japan holds a Guinness World Record for being the busiest transport hub – approximately three million people walk through its turnstiles every single day!

7- The Sirkeci Train Station inaugurated back then on November 3rd of1890; It’s recognized as one of Turkey's most significant sites because it's here that Orient Express came to an end upon its arrival after disembarking France’s Paris destination via train route.

8- Novoslobodskaya Underground Metro Rail System facility within Moscow-Russia gains public recognition & appeal owing significantly towards artistic craftsmanship/glory exemplified primarily via its beautiful mosaics & enticing stained glass panelling/lining work accomplishments

9- Mumbai-Pune shuttle/train service started originally during year1867 got acclaimed/feted especially when India achieved ‘project independence status’
